result.execSummary:
The defendant Vasilios Katakis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vasilios Katakis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vasilios Katakis was found guilty of Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:55 Defendant Vasilios  Katakis in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Vasilios  Katakis in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THorie: guilty Ct#2 in the information. 2 year probations, consecutive to MN prison term, based on detainer paperwork.. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. agree to cooperate with the investigation of co defendant's. Dismiss Ct#1. Atty Loberg and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2; Loberg stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#2. Dismiss Ct#1. Thorie and Loberg address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years probation; consecutive to his prison sentence in MN. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, agree to cooperate with the investigation and prosecution of co defendant's; including giving truthful testimony if requested by the Pierce County District Attorney's office.  If a breach of the agreement to testify and cooperate; that will be a violation of probation.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
